newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Pallada launches equity unit fund.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Pallada launches equity unit fund.

text.p: Russian fund manager ZAO Pallada Asset Management has opened subscription to a unit fund investing in corporate securities, the company said on Wednesday.
Pallada Corporate Fund will invest in bank deposits, equities and bonds of Russian companies, government and municipal securities, it said in a statement.
The Fund became Russia's second mutual fund to invest in equities after OAO Mutual Funds Credit Suisse (Moskva) AO, which closed its first round of subscription on March 4.
Pallada Corporate's minimum investment for the first round of subscription, which will last about three months, is 100 million roubles ($18,000).
OOO Pervy Rossiisky Spetsializirovanny Depositary will be the fund's depositary and register.
Pallada Corporate Fund is Pallada's second fund. Pallada Government Securities, dedicated to GKO discount Treasury bills, was launched in November.
Pallada Asset Management was set up by Commonwealth Property Investors, an affiliate of U.S. pension fund adviser Aldrich, Eastman & Waltch and Boston Capital Management Group.
It said investors in Pallada Government Securities could move funds into Pallada Corporate Fund without any fees.
